questions.question: What is static
questions.answer: The default position; the element will flow into the page as it normally would. The top, right, bottom, left and z-index properties do not apply.

questions.question: What is relative
questions.answer: The element's position is adjusted relative to itself, without changing layout (and thus leaving a gap for the element where it would have been had it not been positioned).

questions.question: What is absolute
questions.answer: The element is removed from the flow of the page and positioned at a specified position relative to its closest positioned ancestor if any, or otherwise relative to the initial containing block. Absolutely positioned boxes can have margins, and they do not collapse with any other margins. These elements do not affect the position of other elements.

questions.question: What is fixed
questions.answer: The element is removed from the flow of the page and positioned at a specified position relative to the viewport and doesn't move when scrolled.

questions.question: What is sticky
questions.answer: Sticky positioning is a hybrid of relative and fixed positioning. The element is treated as relative positioned until it crosses a specified threshold, at which point it is treated as fixed positioned.

questions.question: Flexbox vs Grid
questions.answer: The basic difference between CSS Grid Layout and CSS Flexbox Layout is that flexbox was designed for layout in one dimension - either a row or a column. Grid was designed for two-dimensional layout - rows, and columns at the same time

questions.question: flex-grow 1
questions.answer: The flex-grow CSS property sets the flex grow factor of a flex item main size. It's telling the items to consume free space.

table.title: inline
content: This one displays the element inline or on the same line. In other words, inline elements do NOT start on a new line and only takes up as much width as its content.
Any height and width properties will have no effect.

table.title: block
content: Starts on a NEW line and takes up the full width available.
Block elements will occupy the entire width of its parent element.

table.title: inline-block
content: This one displays the element inline or on the same line. In other words, inline elements do NOT start on a new line and only takes up as much width as its content.
Can set height and width values.
